item.title: Brenton Tarrant: Christchurch gunman given life term without parole
item.description: The judge called the actions of a man who murdered 51 people in two mosques in New Zealand last year "inhuman".

item.title: Coronavirus: Payment for people on low incomes who must self-isolate
item.description: In England, people on low incomes self-isolating in areas where coronavirus cases are high will get help.

item.title: Jacob Blake: Police officer in Kenosha shooting named
item.description: Wisconsin's attorney general names the officer who shot Jacob Blake seven times in the back.

item.title: NBA, baseball and tennis matches called off in protest
item.description: After Milwaukee Bucks cancelled a fixture over the shooting of Jacob Blake, other basketball, football, tennis and soccer players follow suit.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pent-up demand 'leading to quicker home sales'
item.description: Property deals are racing though compared to last year, as the market recovers after the lockdown freeze.

item.title: UK flu jab rates prompt complacency warning
item.description: Experts fear the winter flu season could coincide with a rise in Covid-19 infections.

item.title: Trump challenges Biden to drug test before debate
item.description: The president claims Mr Biden went from incoherent to articulate in a previous debate.

item.title: A-levels and GCSEs: Boris Johnson blames 'mutant algorithm' for exam fiasco
item.description: Teachers' union says the PM is trying to "shrug away" responsibility for this year's exam problems.

item.title: Chief education civil servant Jonathan Slater sacked after exams row
item.description: The Department for Education's permanent secretary will leave as the PM calls for "fresh leadership".

item.title: Hurricane Laura ‘will cause unsurvivable storm surge’
item.description: Hurricane Laura, heading for Texas and Louisiana, is now a Category 4 storm, weather officials say.

item.title: Celtic in earliest Champions League exit since 2005
item.description: Celtic suffer their earliest Champions League exit since 2005 after losing 2-1 to Hungarian side Ferencvaros in Glasgow.

item.title: Coronavirus: Delayed EasyJet passengers face unforeseen quarantine
item.description: The airline says it could not book enough rooms in Gibraltar so some passengers spent the night in Spain.

item.title: The Papers: 'Paid to quarantine' and ghost town UK 'needs saving'
item.description: The plan to pay people in certain areas who are on low incomes to self-isolate features on Thursday's front pages.

item.title: WindowSwap: ‘I think we all are explorers in our own ways’
item.description: People from around the world are sharing videos of what’s outside their windows.

item.title: Warning over 'dangerous' DIY beauty trends on TikTok
item.description: Teenagers have posted videos of supposed teeth-whitening, lip-plumping and mole-removal tips.

item.title: Telford boy calls number on toy ambulance to get help for ill mum
item.description: "Brave" Josh made the call when he found his mum lying unconscious on the floor at their home.

item.title: RNC 2020: What young Republicans think of Trump
item.description: The BBC spoke to young Republicans in the lead-up to the 2020 presidential election.

item.title: Endangered red panda cub born as Whipsnade Zoo reopened
item.description: The cub was the size of a human finger when it was born on 19 June, zoo says.

item.title: Plymouth MP Johnny Mercer injured in canoe accident
item.description: Plymouth MP Johnny Mercer needed surgery after capsizing in the River Tamar.

item.title: Did Messi really send his Barcelona transfer request by fax?
item.description: A short history of fax, why Messi had to use Spain's burofax system and some more fax facts.

item.title: Plane built on Mumbai rooftop takes to the skies
item.description: No one believed pilot Amol Yadav when he told them his plans, but he proved them wrong.

item.title: The effect of coronavirus on DJs, musicians and clubbing
item.description: DJ and broadcaster Jamz Supernova looks at what impact the pandemic has had on the clubbing industry.

item.title: Lockdown may have lasting effects on friendships
item.description: Some marginal friendships will by lost, says psychologist, while other deeper ones may need work.

item.title: Foster carer who took on two young children at age of 21
item.description: Rachel James takes up the role after hearing emergency carers were needed during the pandemic.

item.title: Beirut residents fear they may lose their homes to gentrification after blast
item.description: Mrs Beaini has lived in the same Beirut house for more than 60 years, but she can't afford repairs.

item.title: Rock star Jack White's auction to help John Peel Centre
item.description: Jack White is selling guitars, a White Stripes drum kit and other memorabilia to aid the centre.

item.title: Scottish farmers star in Pharrell Williams and Jay-Z video
item.description: The Aberdeenshire couple initially thought the request for help was a hoax but they have now found fame.

item.title: Storm Francis: In pictures
item.description: Pictures show the effects of Storm Francis's strong winds and heavy rain in the UK.

item.title: The 'selfish waster' who now runs a monastery
item.description: How a rebellious young man from Tibet ended up as abbot of a Buddhist centre in southern Scotland.

item.title: Why have there been so many U-turns recently?
item.description: There is some disquiet among Tory MPs - but there is evidence the public views a change of direction with sympathy.

item.title: Blueberry farmers warn of 'disaster' crop
item.description: Wild blueberry farmers in the US state of Maine are now facing numerous challenges.

item.title: India NEET, JEE exams: 'Conducting these exams will be a giant mistake'
item.description: Indian students are demanding that competitive college exams be postponed due to the pandemic.

item.title: Eat Out to Help Out: The highs and lows of the coronavirus discount scheme
item.description: Some of the highs and lows of the government's discount scheme for diners.

item.title: Tony Hall: Departing BBC boss looks back on his time in charge
item.description: Lord Hall is stepping down as director general of the BBC after seven years in the role.

item.title: Harry Maguire: Why his Greek trial went so fast
item.description: Greek justice threw the book at Harry Maguire, and fast, but the case throws up a number of questions.

item.title: 'I took a pay cut but at least I kept my job’
item.description: Companies across the UK have asked staff to accept lower pay in order to avoid lay-offs.

item.title: Climate change: How the UK contributes to global deforestation
item.description: Chocolate, pizza, shampoo.... Just some of the things that could be making climate change worse.

item.title: Lionel Messi hands in Barcelona transfer request: Where could he go next?
item.description: Every club in the world would love to have Lionel Messi but few could afford him, so where could he end up if he does leave Barcelona?

item.title: Melania Trump: The unusual, traditional First Lady
item.description: From her modelling career to involvement in politics, this is what we know about the US First Lady.

item.title: Maguire's legal team lodges appeal against guilty verdict
item.description: Harry Maguire's legal team lodges an appeal against the guilty verdict that led to him receiving a suspended jail sentence of 21 months and 10 days in Greek court, Manchester United say.

item.title: England's Parris sent off but Lyon reach ninth Women's Champions League final
item.description: Wendie Renard secures Lyon a record ninth appearance in the Women's Champions League final with a 1-0 win over Paris St-Germain.

item.title: 'If you don't want to be here, leave,' Lennon tells Celtic players after Champions League exit
item.description: Celtic "only have themselves to blame" after suffering a shock Champions League exit in Glasgow at the hands of Ferencvaros, says manager Neil Lennon.

item.title: Messi's dad in England for talks over son's next move - Thursday's football gossip
item.description: Lionel Messi's dad is talking to Manchester City, Manchester United have the money for the Barcelona icon, plus more.

item.title: Chelsea sign England left-back Chilwell from Leicester for £45m
item.description: Chelsea sign England left-back Ben Chilwell from Leicester on a five-year deal for £45m.

item.title: Barcelona want to 'build team around Messi', says sporting director
item.description: Barcelona still plan to build a team around Lionel Messi and do not want him to leave, says sporting director Ramon Planes.

item.title: England v Pakistan: James Anderson takes his 600th Test wicket
item.description: James Anderson dismisses Pakistan's Azhar Ali to become the first seam bowler in history to take 600 Test wickets.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: Good ventilation could be key to avoiding coronavirus this autumn as people spend more time indoors.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK's travel rules and which countries can you visit?
item.description: New rules mean people entering the UK from certain countries will not have to quarantine.

item.title: Coronavirus: How will deaf schoolchildren cope with face coverings? And other questions
item.description: Local lockdowns are in force in England, but what are the rules? We answer some of your questions.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can I work from home overseas?
item.description: Thinking about setting up a home office abroad? Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: The guidance on who should wear face coverings varies around the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: How can I find a new job?
item.description: Jobseekers are having a tough time at the moment but some sectors are hiring and support is available.

item.title: Coronavirus: When does the 'eat out to help out scheme' end?
item.description: Thousands of venues have taken part in a discounting scheme to help boost the hospitality industry.

item.title: Coronavirus: Does my child have to return to school?
item.description: Parents are being urged to send their children back to school for the autumn term

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the UK travel quarantine rules?
item.description: France and the Netherlands are the latest places from where people must quarantine on arriving in the UK.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are teachers more at risk of coronavirus?
item.description: Children are at low risk from the disease, but concerns have been raised for teachers.

item.title: Coronavirus: How are other countries getting children back to class?
item.description: Children are starting a new school year across Europe. What measures are being put in place?

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: What tests are available?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: BTec Nationals and Firsts: What went wrong with the grades?
item.description: The BTec First grades have been delayed. What caused the problems with the results?

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Teams around the world are looking into medicines for Covid-19 and scientists are starting to discover what works.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does Covid-19 test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are now being traced.

item.title: Europe lockdown: New coronavirus rules country by country
item.description: What are European countries doing to control new coronavirus outbreaks?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules around evictions?
item.description: The ban on evictions has been extended, but how do they work?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the risks of catching it from food packaging?
item.description: Some cases around the world have been linked to packaging on frozen food.
